bio: Aleah is a first-year masters student in visual journalism from Willow Spring, NC. She is interested in how new media creates an intersection between journalism and activism.

Alexis Barnes, aka the 360 Stitch Master, is a junior, studying multimedia journalism, media production, and history. Alexis is a developer for the Old Man At Sea story and works with post-production of the 360 videos. At any time she can be spotted sitting at a computer listening to music.

Andy Roberson is from Iron Station, NC. She is majoring in Multimedia and minoring in computer science. When sheâ€™s not coding, she enjoys eating jelly beans and imagining a world where George R.R. Martin actually publishes a book when he says he will.

Anna is a first year MA student studying visual journalism. Prior to coming to UNC, she spent three years freelancing in Cambodia, where she learned to love homemade noodles, extremely hot weather, street dogs, and long bike rides. Anna is passionate about telling empowering stories about women.

Anne Marie Hagerty is a Broadcast Journalism major with a History and Music minor at the UNC-Chapel Hill and works as an Assignment Editor for NBC-affiliate, WRAL-TV News, on the weekends. Anne Marie is pursuing a career as an international political news reporter with a focus on humanitarian issues. Anne Marie likes to play anything by Chopin on the piano, pretend she is good at running, indulge with coffee ice cream and watch New Girl in her free time.
Caroline is a Multimedia major and Studio Art minor who loves to create. She appreciates life's beauty and hopes use her skills to share that beauty with the world.
Carolyn Bahar is a freelance designer and illustrator. She likes to draw food and tinker with type. She is very interested in the intersection between products (physical or digital) and branding.

Casey Toth is a visual journalist, native to North Carolina, with a consistent hankering for good food and open spaces. She loves telling stories about our food production system, big or small, and the resulting environmental impacts, good or bad. Working on "Built with Bananas" was a dream come true for her.
Claire was born in Hong Kong and grew up in Amman, Jordan. She studies photojournalism and likes to climb trees.

Clare Fieseler is a PhD Candidate in Ecology. Her research focus on coral reef ecology and conservation. Her photography is represented by National Geographic Creative. Her career bridge science and media but she's really in it for the love of maniacally off-roading in far off places.

Cori is a senior graphic design and interactive multimedia major who loves being artistic and creative and hates writing team bios. She was born and raised in Winter Park, Florida and has loved art and design since she was a little girl. She has hated writing bios since the past 3-4 minutes, but she anticipates that the feeling will last.

Poems and prose and creating pathos. This is what Janell is made of. A senior majoring in journalism and global studies, Janell has used her writing and reporting to promote public service, social justice and participation in local government. She plans to combine her passion for writing and the community as she pursues her juris doctor in immigration law.

Justina is a writer on the project and a junior at UNC-Chapel Hill majoring in business journalism with an ~unofficial~ minor in data journalism & visualization. She enjoys being part of innovation in the media industry and prefers jazz music and "Grey's Anatomy" to many other pastimes.
Kira Dalman is a junior at UNC Chapel Hill. She is a photojournalist major from Asheville, NC. Kira enjoys hiking, reading, traveling and spending time with her family.

Kristi is an senior from Albemarle, NC studying design and interactive storytelling at UNC-Chapel Hill. She hopes to pursue a career as a developer in visual journalism. If she's not at her computer, she's likely in the yoga studio or out hiking.

Mac is a senior video/photojournalism student who lives for good dogs, good meals, and well-told stories. He gets most excited when meeting new people and adventuring into the unknown, and he can't wait to see where his camera takes him next.

Michelle is a visual storyteller with photo, video and graphic story telling chops. She loves listening to people's stories, learning new things and discovering the unexpected and uses her camera as an excuse to be nosy...in a good way.

A senior double majoring in Broadcast Journalism and Global Studies, Paris aspires to help people of all cultures and ages tell their own stories via citizen journalism. In addition to Panama, she has used her writing and video production skills to tell stories across North Carolina, as well as in Philadelphia, PA, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, and Morocco. Paris loves telling and being told stories that touch on race, culture, and lived experience.
Patrick Seelinger is a media and journalism major from Raleigh, NC. In addition to web development, he enjoys writing music and hiking.
Sophia Nahli Allison is a graduate student studying visual journalism.  She is from Los Angeles, CA. Sophia is a black kween and believes Jimi Hendrix is her spirit animal.
Tegan Johnston is senior photojournalism major from Raleigh, NC. Her friends know her as the "Sloth Whisperer.

Alissa is a Photojournalism and Anthropology major from Cary, NC. She dreams of and aspires to help create a world where chickens can cross the road without being questioned. Her camera is her tool to spark conversations about the seemingly insignificant.
Steven King is a professor to tarheels and a former muckraker for the Washington Post. As a master of computer science he works with various technologies such as virtual reality to tell stories.
